description: The classic Filipino chicken adobo is a stew that is cooked either by braising or simmering, with tangy flavors from garlic, vinegar, crushed peppercorns, soy sauce, broth, bay leaves, and salt.

step_by_step: ["In a large bowl, combine the chicken pieces with the vinegar, soy sauce, peppercorns, bay leaves, and garlic. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours or up to overnight.", "Combine the chicken and its marinade with the broth or water in a large stockpot or Dutch oven. Add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.", "Lower the heat and simmer uncovered until the liquid is reduced by half and the chicken registers at least 165Â° F on an instant-read thermometer.", "Using a slotted spoon, remove the chicken pieces and drain well on paper towels. Set the sauce aside.", "In a wide saucepan or deep skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and fry for 1-2 minutes.", "Add the chicken pieces one at a time and fry until the skin is crisp and dark brown, about 5 minutes per side.", "Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning with more salt, if needed. notes: Marinating time can range from 6 to 24 hours. For a less greasy version, the adobo can be served straight after the slow simmer.
